name: Spiritland
notes: The Spiritland ‘What’s On’ listings show a series of music events at its King’s Cross listening bar.  For late November 2025 these include DJ Scribe The Valiant on 18 Nov 2025 (19:00–23:00):contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}, 6 Million Steps on 21 Nov 2025 (20:00–01:00):contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}, Kayyak on 22 Nov 2025 (20:00–01:00):contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2} and a Sunday Salons talk on 23 Nov 2025:contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}.  The ‘Find us’ page gives the address 9–10 Stable Street, London N1C 4AB, along with contact number 020 3319 0050 and opening hours:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}.  These details confirm the venue is open, hosting late‑2025 events and fits the nostalgic/ecstatic listening bar mood.

name: Horniman Museum and Gardens
notes: Although the Horniman’s own website has occasional SSL issues, third‑party sources confirm it continues to operate and host public events.  MexiBrit’s write‑up of the museum’s **Day of the Dead Family Festival** notes that the festival takes place at the Horniman Museum and Gardens on Saturday 1 Nov 2025 (11 am–4 pm):contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5} and describes live music, dance, crafts, workshops and a Mexican market:contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}.  The same article mentions an **Evening Fiesta** held in the Horniman Conservatory on the evening of 1 Nov 2025 (7 pm–10:30 pm) with DJ sets and live performances:contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}.  Previous contact information lists the museum at 100 London Road, Forest Hill, London SE23 3PQ with phone 020 8699 1872 and email enquiry@horniman.ac.uk (from the Horniman’s contact page).  These sources show the museum remains open and is hosting family‑friendly and curiosity‑driven events in late 2025.

name: South London Gallery
notes: The South London Gallery’s event calendar lists a range of exhibitions and events for autumn/winter 2025.  Key late‑2025 events include *Metabolizer: Camberwell College of Arts MA Fine Art Research Show* (14 Nov 2025), *South by South: A View From Tangier* (19 Nov 2025), *Teachers’ CPDL: Yto Barrada* (26 Nov 2025), *South By South: What Grows Between* (3 Dec 2025), a *Festive Shopping Evening* on 10 Dec 2025 and family workshops on 29 Nov 2025:contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}.  The gallery’s contact page lists the main address as 65‑67 Peckham Road, London SE5 8UH and a second site at 82 Peckham Road (SE15 5LQ) with opening times (Wed–Fri 12 pm–6 pm, Wed until 9 pm, Sat/Sun 12 pm–6 pm):contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}.  This confirms the gallery is open, accurately located, and offering thoughtful community‑focused art programmes in late 2025.

name: Half Moon Theatre
notes: Half Moon Theatre remains active and specialises in children’s and family shows.  Its ‘What’s On’ listings include **The Chaos That Has Been and Will No Doubt Return** on 17 Nov 2025:contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}, **The Three Bears** from 20–22 Nov 2025:contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11} and **Shed‑ache** on 28–29 Nov 2025:contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}.  Each event page states the theatre’s address (Half Moon Young People’s Theatre, 43 White Horse Road, London E1 0ND) and notes that performances are relaxed and accessible:contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}:contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}.  These details show the venue is open, accurately located, hosting late‑2025 family shows and aligns with the tender, thoughtful mood tags.

name: Chickenshed Theatre
notes: Chickenshed is an inclusive theatre company based at 290 Chase Side, London N14 4PE with contact number 020 8292 9222:contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}.  Its calendar lists a packed programme for late 2025: the community choir runs 5 Nov – 10 Dec 2025:contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}; the major winter production **Red** runs 19 Nov 2025 – 10 Jan 2026:contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}; **Christmas Tales** (29 Nov – 29 Dec 2025) and a **Christmas Concert** on 7 Dec 2025:contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}; and various festive activities for babies and toddlers:contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}.  This demonstrates that the theatre is open, located correctly, hosting numerous public events and embodies the inclusive activist/community ethos.

name: Graeae Theatre Company
notes: Graeae is a radical theatre company championing Deaf, disabled and neurodivergent artists.  Its homepage states that the company “create[s] radical theatre, placing access at the heart of our work”:contentReference[oaicite:20]{index=20}.  The ‘Your Visit’ page gives the address **Bradbury Studios, 138 Kingsland Road, London E2 8DY** with contact phone 020 7613 6900 and directions:contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}.  The company’s 2025 production **Bad Lads** tours nationally from 2 Oct – 15 Nov 2025:contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22} but there is no evidence of public performances after mid‑November.  As of late November 2025 there are no events scheduled on Graeae’s site, so the late‑2025 programming status is uncertain; however, the company remains active with workshops and advocacy.  Its focus on accessibility and social justice aligns strongly with the activist and voice mood tags.

name: Tara Theatre
notes: Tara Theatre in Earlsfield lists several late‑2025 productions.  The ‘What’s On’ page advertises the political satire **I Dream of Theresa May** running 17 Nov – 29 Nov 2025:contentReference[oaicite:23]{index=23}.  A community‑created show **Echoes of Earlsfield** takes place on 5 Dec 2025; the event page describes an intergenerational journey through Earlsfield’s past and lists the date (5 Dec 2025), venue (Tara Theatre) and free ticketing:contentReference[oaicite:24]{index=24}.  Comedy night **The Funny Side of Earlsfield** follows on 6 Dec 2025 with details of performers and accessible seating:contentReference[oaicite:25]{index=25}.  The venue’s footer lists contact information: box office 020 8333 4457 and address **356 Garratt Lane, Earlsfield, London SW18 4ES**:contentReference[oaicite:26]{index=26}.  This confirms the theatre is open, located correctly, hosting events into December 2025 and aligns with the ritual/voice/activist mood tags.

name: Autograph (Rivington Place)
notes: Autograph’s gallery at Rivington Place hosts the major exhibition **I Still Dream of Lost Vocabularies** from 10 Oct 2025 – 21 Mar 2026:contentReference[oaicite:27]{index=27}.  The exhibition page lists the address **Autograph, Rivington Place, London EC2A 3BA** and specifies opening hours (Wed & Fri 11 am–6 pm, Thu 11 am–9 pm, Sat 12:30–6 pm):contentReference[oaicite:28]{index=28}.  Autograph also runs related events, including a **BSL Response** tour on 25 Nov 2025 (6:30–8 pm) where artist Rubbena Aurangzeb‑Tariq provides a British Sign Language introduction; the event page notes the date, time and that it takes place at Autograph’s gallery:contentReference[oaicite:29]{index=29}.  These details show the organisation is open, hosting exhibitions and accessible programmes into 2026.  The exhibition’s focus on political dissent and photographic collage, along with the global roster of artists, matches the activist/awe/global vibe.
